text: The 100 yards event at the 1926 Women's World Games was the second time the 100 yards was held at Women's World Games. The event took place in Gothenburg at the Slottsskogsvallen during the first day of the Games on 27 August 1926. At the 1930 Women's World Games the 100 yards was replaced by the 100 metres event. French Marguerite Radideau won the final in a time of 11.8 seconds, ahead of the British and Japanese Kinue Hitomi. ==Results== ===Heats=== The first athletes of each heat continued to the final. In addition the number two of the first three heat continued. ====Heat 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Marguerite Radideau Q 2 Q 3 Janina Grabicka 12.8 Image of heat 1 4 (#59) ====Heat 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Q 2 Q 3 Yolande Plancke 12.4 q image of heat 2 4 Zinaida Liepiņa ====Heat 3==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Kinue Hitomi Q 2 Q 3 Helena Woynarowska 12.6 Source: ===Final=== Rank Name Nationality Time (s) Notes Marguerite Radideau 11.8 11.8 + 10 cm Kinue Hitomi 12.0 4 +10 cm 5 +20 cm 6 Yolande Plancke 12.8 7 +10 cm Source: ==References== ==Other websites== *newspaper with finish photo, p. 4 Category:1926 Women's World Games
title: 1926 Women's World Games – 100 yards
